questions.question: We need to cut ................................ on luxuries.
questions.description: To cut back on something is to reduce spending on it.

questions.question: You need to cut .............................. on sugar. You are diabetic!
questions.description: To cut back on something is to reduce its consumption.

questions.question: Environmentalists are against the project because they do not want the government to cut .............................. trees to make room for a theme park.
questions.description: To cut down trees is to bring them down by cutting them.

questions.question: If you want to lose weight, you should cut ............................ on your calorie intake.
questions.description: To cut down on something is to reduce the amount of something.

questions.question: If my dad hadn't cut me ..................................., I would never have found a job.
questions.description: To cut someone off is to stop providing financial support to them.

questions.question: That dunce cut me ................................ as I was about to conclude my presentation.
questions.description: To cut somebody off is to interrupt them as they speak.

questions.question: Cut ................................ the lamp when you leave the room.
questions.description: To cut off an electrical device is to turn it off.

questions.question: The health scare compelled him to cut ............................... smoking.
questions.description: To cut out smoking is to refrain from smoking.

questions.question: The generator suddenly cut .................................. and the house plunged into darkness.
questions.description: When a device cuts out, it stops working.

questions.question: We cut .................................... the woods and got home in less than an hour.
questions.description: To cut through something is to take a short cut through it.

questions.question: He was badly cut ..................................... by his attackers.
Critics cut .................................... the movie mercilessly.
questions.description: Cut up can mean criticize or censure.
